intro: Isoloma hypocyrtiflorum, commonly known as the rock dandelion, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky, arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and hairy, while its flowers are yellow with a distinctive, flattened center. Isoloma hypocyrtiflorum is often found in fynbos vegetation, contributing to the biodiversity of its native region.
